    • Method Detail

      • run

        void run()
        This method does the import or export

      • encodePath

        static String encodePath(String path)
        Encodes a path (as if from a URI) to avoid characters that may be disallowed in a filename. This operation can be reversed by invoking decodePath(java.lang.String).
        Parameters:
        path - the path portion of a URI
        Returns:
        a version of the path that avoid characters such as ":".

      • decodePath

        static String decodePath(String encoded)
        Decodes a path. This operation can be reversed by invoking encodePath(java.lang.String).
        Parameters:
        encoded - the path portion of a URI
        Returns:
        the original path

      • fileForBinary

        static File fileForBinary(URI uri,
                          String sourcePath,
                          String destinationPath,
                          File baseDir)
        Gets the file where a binary resource at the given URL would be stored in the export package.
        Parameters:
        uri - the URI for the resource
        sourcePath - the base path the resource was exported from
        destinationPath - the base path the resource is importing to
        baseDir - the base directory in the export package
        Returns:
        a unique location for binary resources from the path of the given URI would be stored

      • fileForExternalResources

        static File fileForExternalResources(URI uri,
                                     String sourcePath,
                                     String destinationPath,
                                     File baseDir)
        Gets the file where an external binary resource at the given URL would be stored in the export package.
        Parameters:
        uri - the URI for the resource
        sourcePath - the base path the resource was exported from
        destinationPath - the base path the resource is importing to
        baseDir - the base directory in the export package
        Returns:
        a unique location for external resources from the path of the given URI would be stored

      • fileForURI

        static File fileForURI(URI uri,
                       String sourcePath,
                       String destinationPath,
                       File baseDir,
                       String extension)
        Gets the file where a resource at the given URL with the given extension would be stored in the export package.
        Parameters:
        uri - the URI for the resource
        sourcePath - the base path the resource was exported from
        destinationPath - the base path the resource is importing to
        baseDir - the baseDir directory in the export package
        extension - the arbitrary extension expected the file
        Returns:
        a unique location for resources from the path of the given URI would be stored

      • directoryForContainer

        static File directoryForContainer(URI uri,
                                  String sourcePath,
                                  String destinationPath,
                                  File baseDir)
        Gets the directory where metadata resources contained by the resource at the given URI would be stored in the export package.
        Parameters:
        uri - the URI for the resource
        sourcePath - the base path the resource was exported from
        destinationPath - the base path the resource is importing to
        baseDir - the base directory in the export package
        Returns:
        a unique location for metadata resources contained by the resource at the given URI would be stored

      • checkValidResponse

        static void checkValidResponse(org.fcrepo.client.FcrepoResponse response,
                               URI uri,
                               String user)
        Checks the response code and throws a RuntimeException with a helpful message (when possible) for non 2xx codes.
        Parameters:
        response - the response from a REST call to Fedora
        uri - the URI against which the request was made
        user - the user name for authorization

      • isRepositoryRoot

        static boolean isRepositoryRoot(URI uri,
                                org.fcrepo.client.FcrepoClient client,
                                Config config)
                         throws IOException,
                                org.fcrepo.client.FcrepoOperationFailedException
        Utility method to determine whether the current uri is repository root or not. The repository root is the container with type fcrepo:RepositoryRoot
        Parameters:
        uri - the URI for the resource
        client - the FcrepoClient to query the repository
        config - the Config for import/export
        Returns:
        True if the URI is the root of the repository
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a error with the network connection
        org.fcrepo.client.FcrepoOperationFailedException - if there is a error with Fedora
